replies.bodyText:
The reason of using equalIgnoreCae method is because Service level, SelectionMarkState, expectedMark's  mark state is using ExpandableEnum which has selected but in SDK level, it is an enum, which uses SELECTED as the value.
Since we are trying to using expandable enum for SDK level, i will update this. It will just equals()

timeline.bodyText: sorry if I missed it elsewhere, but we said that until the service correctly sends a non-null value in valueSelectionMark, we would return value.text in the meantime. Does this code do that?
timeline.author: kristapratico

replies.bodyText: You mean set the value i.e SELECTED / UNSELECTED to value.text?
replies.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText: I might have commented in the wrong place, but since for a FormField, valueSelectionMark is returning null, we can in the meantime return the text value for a FormField.value. In python, this would be the string "selected" or "unselected" but maybe this would be an enum in Java
replies.author: kristapratico

replies.bodyText: Yes. for consistency, i would use the same temp solution that python and .net does.
